question: Which of the following time signatures have standard notation? <image 1>
description:
The image shows four musical staffs labeled A, B, C, and D. Each staff has a different time signature at the beginning:

- Staff A has a time signature of 6/8.
- Staff B has a time signature of 3/4.
- Staff C has a time signature of 2/4.
- Staff D has a time signature of 6/8.

The question asks which of these time signatures have standard notation. Standard notation typically refers to common time signatures used in music. In this context, 3/4 and 2/4 are considered standard time signatures, while 6/8 is also commonly used but might not be considered as "standard" in the same way as 3/4 and 2/4.

Therefore, the correct answer would be:
A. BC
